principle.name: Automate and Validate MCP Installation
principle.description: Automate MCP setup steps and always validate installation and connectivity after each change.
principle.rationale: Ensures MCPs are reliably integrated and reduces manual errors.

example.scenario: After installing a new MCP from a link
example.good: Run connection tests and verify Roo Code detects the MCP

principle.name: Document All MCP Changes
principle.description: Keep a record of all MCP installations, configuration changes, and troubleshooting steps.

example.good: Log the change and update documentation
example.bad: Make silent changes with no record

principle.name: Use Least Privilege for MCPs
principle.description: Grant MCPs only the permissions they require for their function.
principle.rationale: Improves security and reduces risk of misconfiguration.

example.good: Restrict access to only needed tool groups

convention.rule: Use descriptive, lowercase, hyphenated names for MCPs and configs
Organize MCP configs and logs in dedicated directories

pitfall.why_problematic: Leads to runtime errors and failed connections
pitfall.correct_approach: Always install all required dependencies before registering MCPs

pitfall.description: Not restarting MCP after config changes
pitfall.why_problematic: Changes may not take effect until restart
pitfall.correct_approach: Restart or reload MCP after updating configuration

category.name: before_starting
category.item: Clarify MCP task (install, configure, troubleshoot, build)
Check for existing MCPs and their status

category.name: during_implementation
category.item: Follow workflow steps for the task type

category.name: before_completion
category.item: Verify MCP is operational and recognized by Roo Code
Check for unresolved errors or warnings
